text: St Denys' Church, Sleaford is a medieval church located in Sleaford, Lincolnshire, England. The oldest parts of the present building are the tower and spire. The spire stands 144 feet (44 metres) tall. David Kaye, Lincolnshire (Princes Risborough, UK: Shire, 1995), p. 46 A window tracery is dated to about the late 13th century.John Julius Norwich, Treasures of Britain: The Architectural, Cultural, Historical and Natural Heritage of Britain (New York: W.W. Norton, 2002), p. 579 The Gothic nave, aisles and north transept were built in the 14th century. The church is a Grade I listed building, a term given to "buildings of exceptional interest". == References == Category:Anglican churches in England Category:Gothic architecture Category:Buildings and structures in Lincolnshire Category:14th-century buildings and structures
title: St Denys' Church, Sleaford
